member.summary: Show an error message (last log message if empty), terminate the main loop, and set failure exit code.

member.name: M:Urho.Camera.SetProjection(Urho.Matrix4)
member.summary:
Set custom projection matrix, which should be specified in D3D convention with depth range 0 - 1. Disables auto aspect ratio.
Change any of the standard view parameters (FOV, far clip, zoom, etc.) to revert to the standard projection. Note that the custom projection is not serialized or replicated through the network.

member.name: M:Urho.Camera.ScreenToWorldPoint(Urho.Vector3)
member.summary: Convert normalized screen coordinates (0 - 1) and distance along view Z axis (in Z coordinate) to a world space point. The distance can not be closer than the near clip plane. Note that a HitDistance() from the camera screen ray is not the same as distance along the view Z axis, as under a perspective projection the ray is likely to not be Z-aligned.

member.name: M:Urho.Network.Connection.SendPackageToClient(Urho.IO.PackageFile)
member.summary: Trigger client connection to download a package file from the server. Can be used to download additional resource packages when client is already joined in a scene. The package must have been added as a requirement to the scene the client is joined in, or else the eventual download will fail.

%Database connection.

member.summary: Finalize all prepared statements, close all BLOB handles, and finish all sqlite3_backup objects.

member.name: M:Urho.DbConnection.GetConnectionString
member.summary: Return database connection string. The connection string for SQLite3 is using the URI format described in https://www.sqlite.org/uri.html, while the connection string for ODBC is using DSN format as per ODBC standard.

member.name: M:Urho.DbConnection.IsConnected
member.summary: Return true when the connection object is connected to the associated database.

member.name: P:Urho.DbConnection.ConnectionString
member.summary: Return database connection string. The connection string for SQLite3 is using the URI format described in https://www.sqlite.org/uri.html, while the connection string for ODBC is using DSN format as per ODBC standard.

member.name: P:Urho.DbConnection.Connected
member.summary: Return true when the connection object is connected to the associated database.

members.member: Client->server: send VariantMap of identity and authentication data.
client->server: send controls (buttons and mouse movement).
client->server: scene has been loaded and client is ready to proceed.
server->client: load new scene. in case of empty filename the client should just empty the scene.
server->client: wrong scene checksum, can not participate.
client->server and server->client: remote node event.
packet that includes all the above messages
used to define custom messages, usually of the form msg_user + x, where x is an integer value.
fixed content id for client controls update.

member.name: P:Urho.Graphics.ExternalWindow
member.summary: Return OS-specific external window handle. Null if not in use. Or Set external window handle. Only effective before setting the initial screen mode.

member.name: P:Urho.Graphics.WindowTitle
member.summary:
Return window title.
Or Set window title.

member.name: P:Urho.Graphics.WindowPosition
member.summary: Return window position.

member.name: P:Urho.Graphics.SRGB
member.summary:
Return whether the main window is using sRGB conversion on write.
Or Set whether the main window uses sRGB conversion on write.

member.name: P:Urho.Graphics.Dither
member.summary:
Return whether rendering output is dithered.
Or Set whether rendering output is dithered. Default true on OpenGL. No effect on Direct3D.

member.name: P:Urho.Graphics.FlushGPU
member.summary:
Return whether the GPU command buffer is flushed each frame.
Or Set whether to flush the GPU command buffer to prevent multiple frames being queued and uneven frame timesteps. Default off, may decrease performance if enabled. Not currently implemented on OpenGL.

member.name: P:Urho.Graphics.Orientations
member.summary:
Return allowed screen orientations.
Or Set allowed screen orientations as a space-separated list of "LandscapeLeft", "LandscapeRight", "Portrait" and "PortraitUpsideDown". Affects currently only iOS platform.

member.summary: Return current index buffer. Or Set index buffer.

member.name: M:Urho.Input.SetMouseVisible(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether the operating system mouse cursor is visible. When not visible (default), is kept centered to prevent leaving the window. Mouse visibility event can be suppressed-- this also recalls any unsuppressed SetMouseVisible which can be returned by ResetMouseVisible().

member.name: M:Urho.Input.ResetMouseVisible
member.summary: Reset last mouse visibility that was not suppressed in SetMouseVisible.

member.name: M:Urho.Input.SetMouseGrabbed(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether the mouse is currently being grabbed by an operation.

member.name: M:Urho.Input.ResetMouseGrabbed
member.summary: Reset the mouse grabbed to the last unsuppressed SetMouseGrabbed call.

member.name: M:Urho.Input.SetMouseMode(Urho.MouseMode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the mouse mode. Set the mouse mode behaviour. MM_ABSOLUTE is the default behaviour, allowing the toggling of operating system cursor visibility and allowing the cursor to escape the window when visible. When the operating system cursor is invisible in absolute mouse mode, the mouse is confined to the window. If the operating system and UI cursors are both invisible, interaction with the Urho UI will be limited (eg: drag move / drag end events will not trigger). SetMouseMode(MM_ABSOLUTE) will call SetMouseGrabbed(false). MM_RELATIVE sets the operating system cursor to invisible and confines the cursor to the window. The operating system cursor cannot be set to be visible in this mode via SetMouseVisible(), however changes are tracked and will be restored when another mouse mode is set. When the virtual cursor is also invisible, UI interaction will still function as normal (eg: drag events will trigger). SetMouseMode(MM_RELATIVE) will call SetMouseGrabbed(true). MM_WRAP grabs the mouse from the operating system and confines the operating system cursor to the window, wrapping the cursor when it is near the edges. SetMouseMode(MM_WRAP) will call SetMouseGrabbed(true). MM_FREE does not grab/confine the mouse cursor even when it is hidden. This can be used for cases where the cursor should render using the operating system outside the window, and perform custom rendering (with SetMouseVisible(false)) inside.

member.name: M:Urho.Input.ResetMouseMode
member.summary: Reset the last mouse mode that wasn't suppressed in SetMouseMode.

member.name: M:Urho.Input.AddScreenJoystick(Urho.Resources.XmlFile,Urho.Resources.XmlFile)
member.summary: Add screen joystick. Return the joystick instance ID when successful or negative on error. If layout file is not given, use the default screen joystick layout. If style file is not given, use the default style file from root UI element. This method should only be called in main thread.

member.name: T:Urho.LogicComponent
member.summary: Helper base class for user-defined game logic components that hooks up to update events and forwards them to virtual functions similar to ScriptInstance class.
Helper base class for user-defined game logic components that hooks up to update events and forwards them to virtual functions similar to ScriptInstance class.

member.summary: Make sure you set ReceiveSceneUpdates property to true in order to receive Update events (this porperty is true by default)

member.summary: Called before the first update. At this point all other components of the node should exist.

member.summary: Called on physics post-update

member.name: M:Urho.LogicComponent.OnSetEnabled
member.summary: Handle enabled/disabled state change. Changes update event subscription.

member.name: M:Urho.LogicComponent.Start
member.summary: Called when the component is added to a scene node. Other components may not yet exist.

member.name: M:Urho.LogicComponent.DelayedStart
member.summary: Called before the first update. At this point all other components of the node should exist. Will also be called if update events are not wanted; in that case the event is immediately unsubscribed afterward.

member.name: M:Urho.LogicComponent.Stop
member.summary: Called when the component is detached from a scene node, usually on destruction. Note that you will no longer have access to the node and scene at that point.

member.summary: Called on scene update, variable timestep.

member.summary: Called on physics update, fixed timestep.

member.summary: Trigger all client connections in the specified scene to download a package file from the server. Can be used to download additional resource packages when clients are already joined in the scene. The package must have been added as a requirement to the scene, or else the eventual download will fail.

member.summary: Add a package file for loading resources from by name. Optional priority parameter which will control search order.

member.summary: Add a manually created resource. Must be uniquely named within its type.

member.summary: Remove a resource load directory.

member.summary: Remove a package file. Optionally release the resources loaded from it.

member.summary: Remove a package file by name. Optionally release the resources loaded from it.

member.summary: Release a resource by name.

member.summary: Release all resources of a specific type.

member.summary: Release resources of a specific type and partial name.

member.summary: Release resources of all types by partial name.

member.summary: Reload a resource. Return true on success. The resource will not be removed from the cache in case of failure.

member.summary: Reload a resource based on filename. Causes also reload of dependent resources if necessary.

member.name: M:Urho.Resources.ResourceCache.SetMemoryBudget(Urho.StringHash,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Set memory budget for a specific resource type, default 0 is unlimited.

member.summary: Enable or disable automatic reloading of resources as files are modified. Default false.

member.name: M:Urho.Resources.ResourceCache.SetReturnFailedResources(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable returning resources that failed to load. Default false. This may be useful in editing to not lose resource ref attributes.

member.name: M:Urho.Resources.ResourceCache.SetSearchPackagesFirst(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Define whether when getting resources should check package files or directories first. True for packages, false for directories.

member.name: M:Urho.Resources.ResourceCache.SetFinishBackgroundResourcesMs(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set how many milliseconds maximum per frame to spend on finishing background loaded resources.

member.name: M:Urho.Resources.ResourceCache.AddResourceRouter(Urho.ResourceRouter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a resource router object. By default there is none, so the routing process is skipped.

member.name: M:Urho.Resources.ResourceCache.RemoveResourceRouter(Urho.ResourceRouter)
member.summary: Remove a resource router object.

member.name: M:Urho.Resources.ResourceCache.GetFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Open and return a file from the resource load paths or from inside a package file. If not found, use a fallback search with absolute path. Return null if fails. Can be called from outside the main thread.

member.name: M:Urho.Resources.ResourceCache.GetResource(Urho.StringHash,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return a resource by type and name. Load if not loaded yet. Return null if not found or if fails, unless SetReturnFailedResources(true) has been called. Can be called only from the main thread.

member.name: M:Urho.Resources.ResourceCache.GetTempResource(Urho.StringHash,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Load a resource without storing it in the resource cache. Return null if not found or if fails. Can be called from outside the main thread if the resource itself is safe to load completely (it does not possess for example GPU data).

member.name: M:Urho.Resources.ResourceCache.BackgroundLoadResource(Urho.StringHash,System.String,System.Boolean,Urho.Resources.Resource)
member.summary: Background load a resource. An event will be sent when complete. Return true if successfully stored to the load queue, false if eg. already exists. Can be called from outside the main thread.

member.summary: Return number of pending background-loaded resources.

member.summary: Return added package files.

member.name: M:Urho.Urho2D.Texture2D.SetSize(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32,Urho.TextureUsage,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set size, format, usage and multisampling parameters for rendertargets. Zero size will follow application window size. Return true if successful. Autoresolve true means the multisampled texture will be automatically resolved to 1-sample after being rendered to and before being sampled as a texture. Autoresolve false means the multisampled texture will be read as individual samples in the shader and is not supported on Direct3D9.

member.name: P:Urho.Gui.UI.UseMutableGlyphs
member.summary:
Return whether is using mutable (eraseable) glyphs for fonts.
Or Set whether to use mutable (eraseable) glyphs to ensure a font face never expands to more than one texture. Default false.

member.summary:
Return whether is using forced autohinting.

member.summary:
Get the font subpixel threshold. Below this size, if the hint level is LIGHT or NONE, fonts will use subpixel positioning plus oversampling for higher-quality rendering. Has no effect at hint level NORMAL.
Or Set the font subpixel threshold. Below this size, if the hint level is LIGHT or NONE, fonts will use subpixel positioning plus oversampling for higher-quality rendering. Has no effect at hint level NORMAL.

member.summary:
Get the oversampling (horizonal stretching) used to improve subpixel font rendering. Only affects fonts smaller than the subpixel limit.
Or Set the oversampling (horizonal stretching) used to improve subpixel font rendering. Only affects fonts smaller than the subpixel limit.

member.summary:
Return current UI scale.

Return root element custom size. Returns 0,0 when custom size is not being used and automatic resizing according to window size is in use instead (default).

member.summary: Set whether to render debug geometry. Default true.

member.name: M:Urho.Viewport.SetCullCamera(Urho.Camera)
member.summary: Set separate camera to use for culling. Sharing a culling camera between several viewports allows to prepare the view only once, saving in CPU use. The culling camera's frustum should cover all the viewport cameras' frusta or else objects may be missing from the rendered view.

member.name: M:Urho.Viewport.GetScene
member.summary: Return scene.

member.name: M:Urho.Viewport.GetCamera
member.summary: Return viewport camera.

member.name: M:Urho.Viewport.GetView
member.summary: Return the internal rendering structure. May be null if the viewport has not been rendered yet.

member.name: M:Urho.Viewport.GetRect
member.summary: Return view rectangle. A zero rectangle (0 0 0 0) means to use the rendertarget's full dimensions. In this case you could fetch the actual view rectangle from View object, though it will be valid only after the first frame.

member.name: M:Urho.Viewport.GetRenderPath
member.summary: Return rendering path.

member.name: M:Urho.Viewport.GetDrawDebug
member.summary: Return whether to draw debug geometry.

member.name: M:Urho.Viewport.GetCullCamera
member.summary: Return the culling camera. If null, the viewport camera will be used for culling (normal case).

member.summary: Convert screen coordinates and depth to a world space point.

member.summary: Allocate the view structure. Called by Renderer.

Return scene.

member.summary:
Return viewport camera.

member.name: P:Urho.Viewport.Rect
member.summary:
Return view rectangle. A zero rectangle (0 0 0 0) means to use the rendertarget's full dimensions. In this case you could fetch the actual view rectangle from View object, though it will be valid only after the first frame.
Or Set view rectangle. A zero rectangle (0 0 0 0) means to use the rendertarget's full dimensions.

member.name: P:Urho.Viewport.RenderPath
member.summary:
Return rendering path.
Or Set rendering path.

member.name: P:Urho.Viewport.DrawDebug
member.summary:
Return whether to draw debug geometry.
Or Set whether to render debug geometry. Default true.

member.name: P:Urho.Viewport.CullCamera
member.summary:
Return the culling camera. If null, the viewport camera will be used for culling (normal case).
Or Set separate camera to use for culling. Sharing a culling camera between several viewports allows to prepare the view only once, saving in CPU use. The culling camera's frustum should cover all the viewport cameras' frusta or else objects may be missing from the rendered view.

member.name: P:Urho.Viewport.View
member.summary: Return the internal rendering structure. May be null if the viewport has not been rendered yet.

member.name: P:Urho.Actions.ActionState.Target
member.summary:
Gets or sets the target.
Will be set with the 'StartAction' method of the corresponding Action. When the 'Stop' method is called, Target will be set to null.

member.name: P:Urho.Actions.ActionState.IsDone
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is done.
member.value: true if this instance is done; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Urho.Actions.ActionState.Stop
member.summary: Called after the action has finished. It will set the 'Target' to null. IMPORTANT: You should never call this method manually. Instead, use: "target.StopAction(actionState);"

member.name: M:Urho.Actions.ActionState.Step(System.Single)
member.summary:
Called every frame with it's delta time.
DON'T override unless you know what you are doing.

member.name: M:Urho.Actions.ActionState.Update(System.Single)
member.summary: Called once per frame.
member.param:
A value between 0 and 1
For example:
0 means that the action just started 0.5 means that the action is in the middle 1 means that the action is over

member.remarks: The IntVector2 structure is suitable for interoperation with unmanaged code requiring two consecutive ints.

member.summary: Creates a perspective projection matrix.

Aspect ratio of the view (width / height)
Distance to the near clip plane
Distance to the far clip plane
A projection matrix that transforms camera space to raster space
member.exception:
Thrown under the following conditions:
fovy is zero, less than zero or larger than Math.PI
aspect is negative or zero
zNear is negative or zero
zFar is negative or zero
zNear is larger than zFar

member.remarks: The Vector3 structure is suitable for interoperation with unmanaged code requiring three consecutive floats.

member.name: T:Urho.Context
member.summary: Urho3D execution context. Provides access to subsystems, object factories and attributes, and event receivers.

member.name: M:Urho.Context.CreateObject(Urho.StringHash)
member.summary: Create an object by type hash. Return pointer to it or null if no factory found.

member.name: M:Urho.Context.RegisterFactory(Urho.ObjectFactory)
member.summary: Register a factory for an object type.

member.name: M:Urho.Context.RegisterSubsystem(Urho.UrhoObject)
member.summary: Register a subsystem.

member.name: M:Urho.Context.RemoveSubsystem(Urho.StringHash)
member.summary: Remove a subsystem.

member.name: M:Urho.Context.RemoveAllAttributes(Urho.StringHash)
member.summary: Remove all object attributes.

member.name: M:Urho.Context.RequireSDL(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Initialises the specified SDL systems, if not already. Returns true if successful. This call must be matched with ReleaseSDL() when SDL functions are no longer required, even if this call fails.

member.name: M:Urho.Context.ReleaseSDL
member.summary: Indicate that you are done with using SDL. Must be called after using RequireSDL().

member.summary: Copy base class attributes to derived class.

member.summary: Find the nearest point on the navigation mesh to a given point using the crowd initialized query extent (based on maxAgentRadius) and the specified query filter type.

member.summary: Try to move along the surface from one point to another using the crowd initialized query extent (based on maxAgentRadius) and the specified query filter type.

member.summary: Return a random point on the navigation mesh using the crowd initialized query extent (based on maxAgentRadius) and the specified query filter type.

member.name: M:Urho.Navigation.CrowdManager.GetRandomPointInCircle(Urho.Vector3,System.Single,System.Int32,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: Return a random point on the navigation mesh within a circle using the crowd initialized query extent (based on maxAgentRadius) and the specified query filter type. The circle radius is only a guideline and in practice the returned point may be further away.

member.name: M:Urho.Navigation.CrowdManager.GetDistanceToWall(Urho.Vector3,System.Single,System.Int32,Urho.Vector3*,Urho.Vector3*)
member.summary: Return distance to wall from a point using the crowd initialized query extent (based on maxAgentRadius) and the specified query filter type. Maximum search radius must be specified.

member.name: M:Urho.Navigation.CrowdManager.Raycast(Urho.Vector3,Urho.Vector3,System.Int32,Urho.Vector3*)
member.summary: Perform a walkability raycast on the navigation mesh between start and end using the crowd initialized query extent (based on maxAgentRadius) and the specified query filter type. Return the point where a wall was hit, or the end point if no walls.

member.summary: Test if a certain feature is enabled (see IKEffector::IKEffectorFeature).

member.summary: Enable or disable a certain feature (see IKEffector::IKEffectorFeature).

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.GetTargetNode
member.summary: Retrieves the node that is being used as a target. Can be NULL.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.SetTargetNode(Urho.Node)
member.summary:
The position of the target node provides the target position of the effector node. The IK chain is solved such that the node to which this component is attached to will try to move to the position of the target node.
A scene node that acts as a target. Specifying NULL will erase the target and cause the solver to ignore this chain.
You will get very strange behaviour if you specify a target node that is part the IK chain being solved for (circular dependency). Don't do that.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.GetTargetName
member.summary: Retrieves the name of the target node. The node doesn't necessarily have to exist in the scene graph.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.SetTargetName(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the name of the target node. The node doesn't necessarily have to exist in the scene graph. When a node is created that matches this name, it is selected as the target.
This clears the existing target node.

member.summary: Returns the current target position in world space.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.SetTargetPosition(Urho.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the current target position. If the effector has a target node then this will have no effect.

member.summary: Gets the current target rotation in world space.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.SetTargetRotation(Urho.Quaternion)
member.summary: Sets the current target rotation. If the effector has a target node then this will have no effect.

member.summary: Required for the editor, get the target rotation in euler angles.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.SetTargetRotationEuler(Urho.Vector3)
member.summary: Required for the editor, sets the target rotation in euler angles.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.GetChainLength
member.summary: Returns the number of segments that will be affected by this effector. 0 Means all nodes between this effector and the next IKSolver.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.SetChainLength(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the number of segments that will be affected. 0 Means all nodes between this effector and the next IKSolver.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.GetWeight
member.summary: How strongly the effector affects the solution.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.SetWeight(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets how much influence the effector has on the solution. You can use this value to smoothly transition between a solved pose and an initial pose For instance, lifting a foot off of the ground or letting go of an object.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.GetRotationWeight
member.summary: How strongly the target node's rotation influences the solution.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.SetRotationWeight(System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets how much influence the target rotation should have on the solution. A value of 1 means to match the target rotation exactly, if possible. A value of 0 means to not match it at all.
The solver must have target rotation enabled for this to have any effect. See IKSolver::IKEffectorFeature::TARGET_ROTATIONS.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.GetRotationDecay
member.summary: Retrieves the rotation decay factor. See SetRotationDecay() for info.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.SetRotationDecay(System.Single)
member.summary: A factor with which to control the target rotation influence of the next segments down the chain. For example, if this is set to 0.5 and the rotation weight is set to 1.0, then the first segment will match the target rotation exactly, the next segment will match it only 50%, the next segment 25%, the next 12.5%, etc. This parameter makes long chains look more natural when matching a target rotation.

member.name: M:Urho.IKEffector.GetFEATURE_WEIGHT_NLERP
member.summary: Need these wrapper functions flags of GetFeature/SetFeature can be correctly exposed to the editor and to AngelScript and lua.

A scene node that acts as a target. Specifying NULL will erase the target and cause the solver to ignore this chain.
You will get very strange behaviour if you specify a target node that is part the IK chain being solved for (circular dependency). Don't do that.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.RegisterObject(Urho.Context)
member.summary: Registers this class to the context.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.GetAlgorithm
member.summary: Returns the active algorithm.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.SetAlgorithm(Urho.IKSolverAlgorithm)
member.summary: Selects the solver algorithm. Default is FABRIK. Note that this may not be the most efficient algorithm available. The specialized solvers will be a lot faster. The currently supported solvers are listed below. + **FABRIK**: This is a fairly new and highly efficient inverse kinematic solving algorithm. It requires the least iterations to reach its goal, it does not suffer from singularities (nearly no violent snapping about), and it always converges. + **2 Bone**: A specialized solver optimized for 2 bone problems (such as a human leg) + **1 Bone**: A specialized solver optimized for 1 bone problems (such as a look-at target, e.g. eyes or a head)

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.GetFeature(Urho.IKSolverFeature)
member.summary: Test if a certain feature is enabled (see IKSolver::IKSolverFeature).

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.SetFeature(Urho.IKSolverFeature,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable a certain feature (see IKSolver::IKSolverFeature).

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.GetMaximumIterations
member.summary: Returns the configured maximum number of iterations.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.SetMaximumIterations(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Sets the maximum number of iterations the solver is allowed to perform before applying the result. Depending on the algorithm, you may want higher or lower values. FABRIK looks decent after only 10 iterations, whereas Jacobian based methods often require more than a 100. The default value is 20.
Most algorithms have a convergence criteria at which the solver will stop iterating, so most of the time the maximum number of iterations isn't even reached.
Number of iterations. Must be greater than 0. Higher values yield more accurate results, but at the cost of performance.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.GetTolerance
member.summary: Returns the configured tolerance.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.SetTolerance(System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the distance at which the effector is "close enough" to the target node, at which point the algorithm will stop iterating.
The distance to set. Smaller values yield more accurate results, but at the cost of more iterations. Generally you'll want to specify a number that is about 1/100th to 1/1000th of the total size of the IK chain, e.g. if your human character has a leg that is 1 Urho3D unit long, a good starting tolerance would be 0.01.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.RebuildChainTrees
member.summary:
Updates the solver's internal data structures, which is required whenever the tree is modified in any way (e.g. adding or removing nodes, adding or removing effectors, etc.).
This gets called automatically for you in Solve().

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.RecalculateSegmentLengths
member.summary:
Unusual, but if you have a tree with translational motions such that the distances between nodes changes (perhaps a slider?), you can call this to recalculate the segment lengths after assigning new positions to the nodes.
This function gets called by RebuildData() and by extension in Solve().

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.CalculateJointRotations
member.summary: Skinned models require joint rotations to be calculated so skinning works correctly. This is automatically enabled by default with the feature flag JOINT_ROTATIONS.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.Solve
member.summary:
Invokes the solver. The solution is applied back to the scene graph automatically.
By default this is called automatically for you if the feature flag AUTO_SOLVE is set. For more complex IK problems you can disable that flag and call Solve() in response to E_SCENEDRAWABLEUPDATEFINISHED. This is right after the animations have been applied.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.ApplyOriginalPoseToScene
member.summary: Copies the original pose into the scene graph. This will reset the pose to whatever state it had when the IKSolver component was first created, or, if the original pose was updated since then (for example if IKSolverFeature::UPDATE_ORIGINAL_POSE is set), will reset it to that state.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.ApplySceneToOriginalPose
member.summary: Copies the current scene graph data into the solvers original pose. You generally won't need to call this, because it gets called for you automatically if IKSolverFeature::UPDATE_ORIGINAL_POSE is set.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.ApplyActivePoseToScene
member.summary: Copies the solvers current active pose into the scene graph. You generally won't need to call this because it gets called for you automatically in Solve(). This is used to apply the solution back to the scene graph.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.ApplySceneToActivePose
member.summary: Copies the current scene graph data into the solvers active pose. You generally won't need to call this because it gets called for you automatically if IKSolverFeature::UPDATE_ACTIVE_POSE is set.

member.name: M:Urho.IKSolver.ApplyOriginalPoseToActivePose
member.summary: Copies the solvers original pose into the solvers active pose. This is used in Solve() automatically if IKSolverFeature::USE_ORIGINAL_POSE is set.

member.name: P:Urho.IKSolver.Algorithm
member.summary:
Returns the active algorithm.
Or
Selects the solver algorithm. Default is FABRIK. Note that this may not be the most efficient algorithm available. The specialized solvers will be a lot faster. The currently supported solvers are listed below. + **FABRIK**: This is a fairly new and highly efficient inverse kinematic solving algorithm. It requires the least iterations to reach its goal, it does not suffer from singularities (nearly no violent snapping about), and it always converges. + **2 Bone**: A specialized solver optimized for 2 bone problems (such as a human leg) + **1 Bone**: A specialized solver optimized for 1 bone problems (such as a look-at target, e.g. eyes or a head)

member.name: M:Urho.Gui.ListView.AddItem(Urho.Gui.UIElement)
member.summary: Add item to the end of the list.

member.name: M:Urho.Gui.ListView.InsertItem(System.UInt32,Urho.Gui.UIElement,Urho.Gui.UIElement)
member.summary: Insert item at a specific index. In hierarchy mode, the optional parameter will be used to determine the child's indent level in respect to its parent. If index is greater than the total items then the new item is inserted at the end of the list. In hierarchy mode, if index is greater than the index of last children of the specified parent item then the new item is inserted next to the last children. And if the index is lesser than the index of the parent item itself then the new item is inserted before the first child item.

member.name: M:Urho.Gui.ListView.RemoveItem(Urho.Gui.UIElement,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Remove specific item, starting search at the specified index if provided. In hierarchy mode will also remove any children.

member.summary: Remove item at index. In hierarchy mode will also remove any children.

member.summary: Return number of worker threads.

member.name: T:Urho.Texture
member.summary: Base class for texture resources.

member.name: M:Urho.Texture.SetNumLevels(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set number of requested mip levels. Needs to be called before setting size. The default value (0) allocates as many mip levels as necessary to reach 1x1 size. Set value 1 to disable mipmapping. Note that rendertargets need to regenerate mips dynamically after rendering, which may cost performance. Screen buffers and shadow maps allocated by Renderer will have mipmaps disabled.

member.summary: Set filtering mode.

member.summary: Set addressing mode by texture coordinate.

member.name: M:Urho.Texture.SetAnisotropy(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set texture max. anisotropy level. No effect if not using anisotropic filtering. Value 0 (default) uses the default setting from Renderer.

member.name: M:Urho.Texture.SetShadowCompare(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set shadow compare mode. Not used on Direct3D9.
